title: Getting an S
body: I just wanted to know what's the eligibility for getting an S or S+? Because I had a clean 15/0/10 kda and 200farm but stil did not get an S. Are you so stingy to hand out tokens because I have been playing jhin continuously for a 2nd S shard for lvl 6 Jhin. Please enlighten me!

replies.body:
Simply put: *there are no requirements for getting an S*.

Huge misconception there. Mastery scores are not on any type of flat scale, rather they're a way of scoring how well you did compared to others in the same boat. 

For instance: If you got an A going bot with Jhin, it doesn't mean you *didn't do good enough*, it means *others did better*. If you ever feel frustrated with the score you get, keep in mind there's something you could improve on. 

You can always read up on how mastery works over here:  https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204211284

From what I have read, riot keeps it a mystery box so people can't abuse the system.
  So yeah everyone has an opinion, but there is no right answer so to speak.

There are many many things that factor into what your rating is. For example, 200 farm is great for 20 minutes but not so much for 35 minutes. so Farm-per-minute is an important factor, trinket warding is also important. I find that a massive amount of contribution to S ranks are based on (role-specific but for this is for adc) over-all damage and objectives aka turrets/epic buffs assisted on. An awesome kda is great but be sure to focus hard on those objectives. That's my two cents.
